job_description: Senior Engineer - job post Motive Companies 6 reviews Canoga Park, CA Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Contract Top aerospace company is looking to add a Senior Engineer to their growing team. Ideal candidates will perform analysis related to gas dynamics, heat transfer, computational fluid dynamics, aerothermodynamics, combustion, hydrodynamics, aerodynamics, and mechanical elements in support of space and defense programs. And also perform analytical predictions and simulations of rocket and high speed air-breathing propulsion systems using computer-based math and simulation models, deriving, creating, documenting, managing, planning verification of, and certifying design compliance to requirements and interfaces for development, production and operational environments. May coordinate risk and opportunity management for development and production programs. Education: Candidate must have a Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering or the equivalent combination of education and a minimum of 9 years of experience Skills and Experience **Candidate must be U.S. citizens without dual citizenship** Essential Job Functions: Perform all or a combination of analysis related to rotating machinery of space & defense systems. Emphasis will be on analysis requiring knowledge of bearings and seals of rotating machinery components. Responsible for utilizing a combination of commercial and in-house developed software tools, and/or hand calculation methods to correlate analysis models and review test data. Support verification tests of propulsion systems and components. Work with designers and project engineers by providing analysis support. Produce analysis reports and test reports. Present analysis to both internal and external customers. 15% - Strengthens the technical capacity of the company and facilitates transfer of technology by mentoring less experienced engineers and team members. $70-$80 DOE IND123 If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Senior Quality Assurance Engineer (Automation) - job post Vantage Point Consulting Los Angeles, CA 90001 Full-time, Contract You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Contract We have an opening for a Senior Quality Assurance Engineer (Automation). Under the direct supervision of the QA Manager, the Senior Quality Assurance Engineer will lead the development of test approaches, estimates and plans for complex integrated systems. They will drive successful QA execution to ensure end results align with business needs in collaboration with other teams. The Senior Quality Assurance Engineer is expected to perform the following tasks individually, with limited guidance: Confirm the highest standards of excellence and operational coherence in the business' software system end points; Provide input on functional requirements and advises on design and configuration of client software applications; Ensure delivery of testable and traceable requirements and effectively applies appropriate testing techniques to ensure comprehensive end-to-end testing; Lead user story review, test case development, and test execution; Design, develop, document and maintain test artifacts for functional, integration, system, and acceptance testing; Create test plans outlining test approach and risk mitigation; Prepare and may oversee the preparation of test data and readiness of test environment prior to test execution; Create & executes automated tests. Generates reporting and defines action plans based on their status; Analyze test results to identify defects, errors and configuration issues, and advises on the severity of issues; Perform defect triage and assesses potential impact and resolution, providing enough details for the development team to fix issues; Publish and communicate test metrics which enable effective decision making around quality; Make recommendations regarding delivery quality and influences the business in implementation decisions; Assist with the preparation of knowledgebase articles for legal applications; and Coordinate with team members on-site, off-site and off-shore. Proficiencies: The Senior Quality Assurance Engineer demonstrates intermediate knowledge of the following processes, tools or applications: Quality Assurance best practices; Test Case / Script Design and Implementation; Microsoft suite and legal software applications (preferred) Business Applications (Microsoft Suite, including Visio, Project, etc.); Experience working with Visual Studio; and Exhibits strong communication, organization, negotiation, critical thinking, and leadership skills as well as exceptional customer service and collaboration abilities. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree (preferred); At least 5 years QA experience supporting large, business critical applications (required); At least 5 years QA experience with Test and Issues Management Tools (TFS, JIRA) (required); Testing Activities, Manual and Automated Testing Procedures and Tools; Solutions Development Life Cycle in Agile & Waterfall Environments; QA Test Management tool (TestRail); Web application architecture (web server, client/server communication, databases, proxy, etc.); Creation and execution of SQL Queries involving multiple tables, join statements and stored procedures; Knowledge of source code management tools (TFS, TFVC); Research and document Web application bugs, providing detailed examination of (JavaScript, JSON, HTML and CSS); API Testing Methods (Post, Put, Get, Delete); Design, build and maintain automation frameworks & scripts using (Visual Studio/.Net/C#/Python/SQL/nUnit/TFS); QA Automation Tools (Selenium WebDriver, Robot Framework), Azure DevOps (CI/CD); Excellent verbal and written communication skills that non-technical end users can understand; Excellent problem solving and analytical skills; Must be highly effective within a collaborative environment; and Strong experience leading teams of peers and partners.

Sr. Systems Engineer - FMEA (Remote) - job post Alten Technology USA 540 reviews Los Angeles, CA • Remote $130,000 - $200,000 a year -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $130,000 - $200,000 a year Job Type Contract Position: Sr. Systems Engineer Location: Petaluma, CA (remote) Duration: 12-month contract engagement. Annualized salary and benefits are offered for the duration of the contract through Alten Technology (medical, dental, vision, PTO, paid holidays, etc.). There is a strong possibility that this contract will be extended beyond the initial contract length. Note: Due to nature of work, only US Persons (citizens or permanent residents) need apply for this position. Who We Are: We’re ALTEN Technology USA, an engineering company that provides solutions for engineering, technology, and product development projects. For decades, we’ve been helping our clients develop products that are changing the world, whether that’s by shaping the future of space exploration, saving lives with medical devices that set a new standard of care, or creating the fully autonomous electric taxi of tomorrow. Our team of more than 600 people works across industries including aerospace, medical devices and life sciences, unmanned systems and robotics, automotive OEM and tier 1 suppliers, commercial vehicle, electric vehicles, rail, and more. Our offices across the US have different industry focuses and engage with our clients in different ways, ranging from working on-site at client facilities to performing product development at our delivery centers. ALTEN Group, our parent company, has been a leader in engineering and information technology for more than 30 years. ALTEN Group operates in 30 countries across Europe, North America, Asia, Africa and the Middle East and employs more than 36,000 people, 88% of whom are engineers. The company covers the whole development cycle and offers a choice of service levels, from technology consulting to complete project outsourcing. When you join ALTEN Technology USA, you join a group of people passionate about collaborating to solve some of the world’s most technical engineering challenges. Our success is tied to taking care of our employees by building relationships and providing opportunities for mentorship and career growth. We offer comprehensive benefits for all full-time employees, including medical, dental, and vision insurance; a 401(k) plan with employer matching; paid time off (PTO); paid parental leave; and mentorship to help you take your career to the next level. You don’t have to take our word for it that we’re a great place to work—we were named on the 2023 Top Workplaces list thanks to feedback from our proud employees. Summary The Senior Systems Engineer is responsible for the overall system design (architecture and interoperability requirements) for the Unmanned Air Vehicles and Ground Support Equipment. The Senior Systems Engineer works closely with equipment manufacturers, Engineering, and Program Management to select the appropriate equipment and ensure it will successfully integrate into the platform to meet the end customer’s requirements. This position is also a key resource for the development and review of specifications, CDRL’s, and ICD’s and assists both the Engineering and Flight Operations Departments to troubleshoot system integration, network protocol, and communication issues. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Engages with Program Manager and/or customer to understand current payload operations and emerging payload requirements. Creates and maintains necessary documentation, such as requirements, high-level design specifications, system limitations, and test plans. Maintains system configuration baselines and reviews Engineering Change Proposals Assists in the generation, evaluation and analysis of data items being generated including specifications, drawings, proposals, plans, cost estimates, SOWs, and reports. Assists in the review and analysis of proposals, specifications, and Interface Control Documents (ICDs). Works with internal and external customers leads to facilitate the resolution of technical issues, which may include formal root cause analysis efforts. Researches and evaluates vendor products, specifications, and manuals to determine appropriateness for application and feasibility of integration. Evaluates customer-provided documentation for compliance with requirements; and identifies system impacts, cost, schedule, and technical performance risks. Leads integration, verification, and validation activities for both internal and external projects and systems. Identifies, analyzes, and resolves system design weaknesses. Prepares technical presentations, and reports for technical design reviews/boards. Education/Experience Bachelor's Degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math) field. 7 years of engineering experience with avionics in the aerospace or defense industries. Technical expertise in aerospace avionics systems to include payloads, communications, and guidance, navigation, and controls. Qualifications : The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required. FMEA (Failure Modes and Effects Analysis), FMECA, FHA, Fault Tree, or SARS (Safety and Reliability Standards) experience required. Experience with signals intelligence technologies and sensors. Ability to walk around the facility on a regular basis to facilitate communication, coordinate tasks and resolve issues. Ability to work in an office and manufacturing environment (Constant). Required to sit and stand for long periods; talk, hear, and use hands and fingers to operate a computer and telephone keyboard (Frequent). Desired skills : Familiarity with aircraft transponder systems and operations. Strong troubleshooting skills and ability to resolve technical issues efficiently and independently. Proven success collaborating with Electrical, Software, Mechanical and other System Engineers to define system architecture and integration details. Experience in trade studies and requirements/interface definitions. Master’s degree in an Engineering field. Salary Range: $130-$200k If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Senior Spacecraft Software Engineer - job post Business Integra Inc 17 reviews El Segundo, CA 90245 $90 - $110 an hour -  Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $90 - $110 an hour Job Type Contract Role: Senior Spacecraft Software Engineer Location: El Segundo, CA Contract to Hire, Direct Client Any Security clearance Please note that the salary information shown above is a general guideline only of what is reasonably expected to be paid for the position. Salaries are based on candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations. Job Summary As a senior spacecraft software engineer , you’ll take responsibility for creating the software that makes our satellites function in orbit. You will be involved in the design and architecture of the software for a spacecraft and leading a team to develop that software. Your code will run on our custom avionics, process signals from sensors like our star trackers, and command actuators like the propulsion system. Your software may also interface with custom payloads and perform high-level autonomy functions to ensure our spacecraft accomplish their missions. We are looking for software engineers that can take ownership of the software for a spacecraft, determine requirements for what it needs to do, and then lead the development of the software while also contributing to the software development. And when that code is running in space, you’ll continue to support mission operations with software updates and enhancements. Job Responsibilities Lead a small team of software engineers to develop the software for a new spacecraft Work collaboratively with hardware, control and system engineers to define and develop software requirements, architectures and designs suited for fault-tolerant spacecraft Rapidly prototype novel software solutions to prove out the architecture/design concepts, quantify technical risk, and create new capabilities Implement designs in C/C++, integrate software components, create and run unit tests, validate on Hardware-in-the-Loop and release real-time embedded solutions Assist with system verification and qualification, assessing the outputs and documenting the results to ensure software products that meet system requirements and mission-critical standards Be responsible for all phases of software development and problem resolution from program inception to post-launch support Work with hardware engineers to verify hardware-hardware and hardware-software interfaces Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or similar with a focus on software development Ability to partition software development into discrete tasks that can be worked on by multiple software engineers. 7+ years of experience in C and C++ programming Experience with Linux in an embedded environment Ability to work effectively in a dynamic environment with changing needs and requirements Ability to work independently and in a team, take initiative, and communicate effectively Preferred Qualifications Experience leading a small team of software engineers Experience with concurrent HW/SW development Experience with board support packages and device drivers Experience with iterative and/or agile development processes Experience with serial data protocols (HDLC, I2C, SPI) Experience in Python programming Experience in Verilog and FPGAs Experience with git, JIRA, confluence Knowledge of satellite systems and components Job Type: Contract Pay: $90.00 - $110.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Flexible schedule Health insurance Paid time off Tuition reimbursement Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour
